page.title: 12Historic Buildings&Monument
page.content: There are 2 large houses in the area. Thirston Hall is South of the Coquet and Felton Park is North-West of the village. Felton Park was built in 1732. In the war it was used as army barracks. There are 26 rooms and 6 acres of land. There is a private tennis court. There are domestic and farm animals. One owner built a Roman Catholic Church which is attached by a corridor to the hall. Thirston Hall was built in 1840. There are 24 rooms and 8 acres of land. There is a private tennis court,croquet lawn and swimming pool. At the entrance there is a very old Sycamore tree. The monument is an obelisk in the North-West corner of the area close by the old A1. It was built in 1807 by Davison of Swarland Hall to commemorate his friendship with Lord Nelson.
